title: Man posts pics of partner on swinger site causing strangers to turn up at home
text:

A 49-year-old builder has admitted publishing naked images and footage of his girlfriend on porn and swingers' websites.

Darren Rowe has been convicted following a complex two-year investigation after police traced the online activity back to a house where he had been doing building work.

Police say he was still in a relationship with his girlfriend at the time when he began secretly posting the pictures online.

The victim, now 39, only became aware of the images circulating online when a friend asked her about them in June 2017, reports Birmingham Live.

She has described how she was put "through hell" after strangers suddenly began turning up at her home, claiming they had conversations with her online and had been invited around.

Police arrested Rowe, from Rowley Regis in the West Midlands, after tracing the online activity to a house in Stourbridge where he had been doing building work.

Rowe admitted two counts of disclosing private sexual photographs and films with intent to cause distress at Wolverhampton Crown Court last week.

He has avoided an immediate jail term, instead receiving a suspended sentence.

(Image: PA Archive/Press Association Images)

West Midlands Police released a statement following the court case detailing how the woman had discovered the images and footage posted online without her consent.

After the friend alerted her to the material posted on the adult websites, the vicitm contacted police fearing it had been spread by a friend following a falling out.

She later discovered images and a video were also being posted on various messaging platforms.

Over the following months, police say men began turning up at the woman's home claiming they had chatted to her online and had been invited around to her house.

Rowe initially denied involvement, but police found mobile phones and electronic devices, including data, which connected him to the images of his then-partner.

Following the court case, his victim said in a statement: "Darren put me through hell and affected my mental health, all whilst trying to convince me that he was here to help me.

"I believe he put me in danger for his own enjoyment and I would encourage any other woman going through something like this to report it.

"I loved this man unconditionally, and for the man you love to try and destroy you mentally is something that you don’t ever get over.

"You learn to live with it daily unfortunately, but time is a good healer. If anyone is going through this, I beg you to speak out, you are not alone.

"Tell a friend or a family member. I know it’s hard, but you can break free."

West Bromiwch PC Lee Newell said it had been "a long and complex case."

"But our investigations revealed that the only person linked to an email address used to transmit the material was in fact Rowe.

"His victim has suffered a distressing onslaught of online abuse. But following this conviction we now wish her well for the future."

Rowe was sentenced last Monday to a 12-month jail term suspended for two years.

He was also ordered to complete a two-year programme including 25 days rehabilitation activity, and 100 hours of unpaid work.

Rowe was also slapped with five-year restraining and sexual harm prevention orders.
description: Darren Rowe, 49, from Rowley Regis in the West Midlands, admitted posting private sexual photographs and video of his partner on adult websites
